title: Heartwood Data & Interface Standards
description: Rules for chronological organization, textual interoperability, and hierarchical proportionality.

principles.text_universality: Treat text streams as the primary interface for interoperability (Unix Philosophy).
principles.chrono_logic: Organize all data by timestamp where possible to ensure chronological integrity.
principles.hierarchy_proportion: Maintain shallow hierarchies; avoid both extreme flatness and deep nesting.
principles.refinement_first: Summarize from the most structured data (JSON) before falling back to raw streams.
principles.polysemy_awareness: Differentiate polysemous terms (root, memory) via the domain ontology.
principles.lifo_context: Apply the LIFO (Last-In, First-Out) principle to chat history to prioritize relevance.
principles.structured_data_mandate: Use tree structures (JSON) whenever possible; fallback to modular legalese if necessary.
